title: Barcelona fans 'attacked by Alaves ultras' wielding metal bars in violent scenes ahead of La Liga clash
text:
Sport Barcelona fans 'attacked by Alaves ultras' wielding metal bars in violent scenes ahead of La Liga clash The violent clashes occurred in the streets of Vitoria ahead of Saturday's encounter and both sides have issued statements condemning the scenes Share Click   Spanish football fans in huge clashes before Barcelona play Alavas Share this video   
Barcelona fans were allegedly attacked ahead of Saturday's victory over Alaves. 
The violent clashes occurred in the streets of Vitoria where a group of Barca supporters are said to have been approached by 50 armed Alaves fans in a local bar. 
Footage taken from the incident in the university district of the city shows a group carrying sticks and metal bars, with tables and chairs also thrown. 
A Barca supporter was taken to hospital after suffering a heavy blow to the head but is now in a stable condition. 
Police arrested a 19-year-old male. Lionel Messi   AFP/Getty) 
Both clubs condemned the violent scenes and have vowed to cooperate with local police to find those involved. 
"FC Barcelona laments and condemns the incidents that occurred this afternoon in the city of Vitoria before the game against Deportivo Alaves," read a statement from the Catalans. 
"The club reiterates its utter rejection of any violent conduct and trusts that the competent authorities will be able to verify the source and responsibility of these events as soon as possible." Luis Suarez celebrates scoring Barcelona's sixth goal (Photo: Getty Images) 
On the pitch, Luis Enrique's men ran out 6-0 winners. 
Lionel Messi, Luis Suarez and Neymar were all on target for the La Liga giants in a dress rehearsal for the Copa del Rey final. Like us on Facebook
